result.execSummary:
The defendant Carrie M Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to Jail (Felony), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1r)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: ANY COUNSELING RECOMMENDED BY THE AGENT

timeConds.notes:
SENTENCED TO 90 DAYS MARQUETTE COUNTY JAIL TO BE SERVED WITHIN 1 YEAR FROM TODAY'S DATE.

4/22/15 AMENDED TO ALLOW HUBER FOR WORK AND FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS

6/22/15 Court will permit the release of defendant on Thursday, June 25, 2015 in the morning. 
Court will stay the remaining balance of her conditional jail time. The balance will be available to the probation agent as a sanction, upon request to the Court, if needed

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carrie M Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carrie M Smith in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant waives her right to counsel for today's hearing.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds waiver of counsel has been made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.
Defendant states her motion for change in sentence.  Atty Hendee responds and will leave the timing of serving the sentence to the Court.  Court questions defendant.
BY THE COURT:  Court will permit the release of defendant on Thursday, June 25, 2015 in the morning.  Court will stay the remaining balance of her conditional jail time.  That balance will be available to the probation agent as a sanction, upon request to the Court, if needed.

Defendant Carrie M Smith in court, in custody.  Andrew Christianson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court states that a letter was received from the defendant asking to modify her sentence.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney. Defendant wants to proceed today without an Attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver of Attorney.
Defendant asks the court for huber privileges for Dr. appointments and for work as she does have a job lined up.
Atty Christianson does not object to huber.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant's motion will be granted; the JOC will be amended to allow Huber for work and for medical appointments.

Defendant Carrie M Smith in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Defendant Carrie M Smith in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
13CF41 & 14CF6:
Atty Hendee states that 14CF6 is settled.  Atty Hendee states that the parties are agreeing to proceed today and the State will file the information with the court later today.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to 14CF6.  Court questions Atty Zamzow regarding the information.  Atty Zamzow has no objection.
BY THE COURT:  State may file the information with the court within 72 hours.
 
Atty Zamzow agrees with the recommendation.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  Atty Hendee states that the court may want to address the waiver of Prelim.  
Court questions the defendant regarding a Preliminary Hearing.  Atty Zamzow states that the defendant will waive the Prelim.  Defendant agrees and waives the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts defendant's waiver.

  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & with full understanding of the consequences.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee asks the court to go along with the recommendation.
Atty Zamzow makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Zamzow states that there are 23 days left on 13CF41 and asks the court to stay that 23 days so the defendant may spend the time with her mother.  Probation Agent does agree to this stay.
Atty Hendee files the information with the court.
  Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.  Atty Zamzow states that her clients No Contest plea would stand.
State takes no position on 13CF41.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 3 years Probation with conditions:
*90 days in the Marquette County Jail (to be served within 1 year from today's date)
*Court Costs = $268.00 + $250 DNA Surcharge
*Any counseling recommended by the Agent
*Report to Probation office today
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

13CF41:
Defendant is to be released; Court stays the 23 days left to serve. 
(to be served within 1 year from today's date)

Defendant Carrie M Smith in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow appearing by telephone.  Defendant Carrie M Smith in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant made a statement before court that she has a letter to the court so she was prepared to proceed without Atty Zamzow.  
Court states that he had his JA contact Atty Zamzow's office and they were not sure if she was going to appear or not with the defendant.  Court questions the defendant.
Defendant states that she did not think that her Attorney was going to appear today and is prepared to proceed without Atty Zamzow today.  
Defendant makes a statement to the court requesting huber be reinstated.
Atty Hendee responds and states that the defendant is on a cash bond and that is why huber is not granted; the huber privileges were not revoked.
Atty Zamzow now appears in court by telephone.  Atty Zamzow asks the court to amend the bond to a signature bond.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant can't post any money.

BY THE COURT:  Bond will remain the same; defendant's motion denied.
Bail/Bond Review on March 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Return date on March 20, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Carrie M Smith in court with attorney Jeanne Zamzow.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Zamzow states the defendant will waive the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.  Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on February 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Carrie M Smith in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Defendant Carrie M Smith in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant failed to report to Jail on February 3, 2014.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Hendee requests a $2,500 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant did turn herself in last night.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 cash bond - no conditions.
Atty Gumz waives the time limits for a Preliminary Hearing.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
DEFENDANT IN CUSTODY - NOTICE OF CANCELLATION FROM MASO
